attributes.action: Public Inquiry into the actions of South Yorkshire Police at Orgreave 1984
attributes.background: At Orgreave, South Yorkshire Police ordered officers to charge "a largely peaceful crowd" & evidence given by South Yorkshire Police (SYP) has been described as "the biggest frame-up ever", SYP had a culture of fabricating evidence, which was not corrected by the time of the Hillsborough disaster.

attributes.action: Stop Proceeds of Crime Act powers from being used in planning cases
attributes.background: Change the law to stop local authorities using powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act in planning cases. The POCA was intended to be used to seize assets of drug dealers, arms dealers etc - serious criminals. Local authorities must be prevented from using it against people for breaching planning laws.
attributes.additional_details: My family are a farming family. Due to an alleged planning infraction and an enforcement order that escalated, the powers in the Proceeds of Crime Act can be used take assets that my family has worked for all of our lives. For our assets (up to and including the family home) to be called a 'proceed of crime' is unjust, immoral and deeply unfair.

attributes.action: Lower the rate of duty on alcoholic beverages in pubs (and restaurants?)
attributes.background: Pubs form a valuable social and community function in many towns and villages and help to make Britain what it is. Towns and villages with good pubs are better than those without. This should be recognised by Government. It is the role of good Government to make this country a better place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
Communal drinking and socialising forms a valuable function in terms of social cohesion and sense of community. Home drinking or street drinking can be actively detrimental to this. Making retail purchased alcohol relatively more expensive would, I believe, help to discourage this. The alternative of course would be raising the level of duty charged on alcoholic beverages bought from retail outlets.

Many thanks for your time.

attributes.action: Create an independent enquiry to determine if foreign powers influenced Brexit.
attributes.background: With allegations of Russian interference in elections in other countries and elements of the Leave campaign facing allegations of violating spending rules that may have influenced the narrow outcome of the referendum, citizens have a right to know if Brexit truly is the will of the British people.
attributes.additional_details: It's everywhere in respected media outlets as well as American intelligence reports.

attributes.action: Ban quad bikes in residential areas
attributes.background: Loud and aggressively speeding quadbikes are everywhere in residential areas morning evening nights. They so loud that my 4 months old son is terrified of them. It’s very normal to see a quadbike speeding 40-50 mph in 20-30 mph zone.
attributes.additional_details:
These quadbike riders do not have any respect for speed limits. 
No respect if someone is ill at home needs rest. 
So loud that little babies waking up screaming. 
And above all safety of our kids on the roads just outside your home.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to vaccinate your children
attributes.background: Intentionally not vaccinating children, except in cases where there are health risks, should not be allowed. It increases the risks of infection to the child and to other children.
attributes.additional_details:
On the 20th August 2018 it was revealed by Public Health England that in the first half of 2018 there were over 800 cases of measles, almost four times as many as there were in the entirety of 2017. 

According to the NHS, 4 out of the 6 vaccinations given to 1 and 2 year olds showed decreases in immunisations which is a worrying development. 
 
France has already made immunizations a legal requirement.
 
Between 2004 and 2014 there were nearly 10,000 cases of Measles and over 81,000 cases of mumps

attributes.action: Please tell Theresa May to withdraw her invitation to tyrant Prayuth Chan-Ocha
attributes.background:
Theresa May has invited Thai dictator Prayuth to the UK on June 20 and hopes to agree new arms deals.
We are UK-based Thais who want democracy and human rights. Please support our message to May: 
Don’t welcome Prayuth to Britain. Tell him to restore Thai democracy. Don’t sell arms to the junta.
attributes.additional_details:
Prayuth seized power in an illegal coup in 2014, overthrowing elected leader Yingluck Shinawatra. The junta has used dictatorial power to repress human rights, prosecute critics of military rule, ban political activity, censor media, and try dissidents in unfair military courts. 

Prayuth was also army chief in 2010 when the military launched a violent crackdown on pro-democracy protesters. More than 90 people were killed and nearly 2,000 wounded.

attributes.action: Negotiate a deal to keep the UK in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government to specifically negotiate the UKs future relationship to the Digital Single Market in the final Brexit deal.  Ignoring the digital economy would put the UK’s future prosperity and thousands of jobs unnecessarily at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
The digital economy is borderless yet depends on consumer trust and business confidence. Leaving the Digital Single Market will tax that confidence in more ways than one. We ask the HM Government to start being responsible for publicly addressing:
(1) future relations to EU agencies such as ENISA and EDPB 
(2) participation in EU funded research 
(3) regulatory alignment to EU rules for telecoms (incl. free roaming), data protection, consumer rights, audio visual media services, and copyright.

attributes.action: stop car insurance companies increasing premiums for no-fault accidents
attributes.background: I had two non fault accidents where the other drivers crashed into me, after which they both admitted fault. However my car insurance company still increased my premiums and called me high risk. I did not claim and at the time of each accident I was driving a company vehicle under company insurance.
attributes.additional_details: I am a class one driver and every year I have to sit a CPC course just to keep my class one license. I also have 11 years NCB on one car and 9 years on another car. I drive every day for my job and do more miles in a week than more people do in a month. But this is done in a company vehicle under company insurance.

attributes.action: Mandatory Autism Awareness training in ALL educational settings
attributes.background: More and more autistic children are loosing out on an education because schools refuse to make reasonable adjustments. We need mandatory Autism Awareness training in ALL educational settings to highlight that small changes can make a huge impact to an individuals education.
attributes.additional_details: Autistic individuals are not difficult or naughty, and they should not be punished with their education at stake when simple adjustments could change the whole educational experience.

attributes.action: Ban TV adverts of  gambling sites and betting firms sponsoring football shirts.
attributes.background:
Gambling addictions are costing the country £1.2bn.
The increasing relationship between football and gambling is normalising gambling  and influencing our vulnerable children and young people. 24/7 access to online betting via smart phones will soon cause a national epidemic. It needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Although not involving a chemical like an addiction to smoking, alcohol or drugs the problem or compulsive gambler is just as much an  addict. They will have financial and relationship problems. They could end up in prison or even committing suicide - suggested rates being 20%.
In 1965 the British Government banned tobacco advertising and in 2005 banned sponsorship of global events.
They need to do the same with gambling and betting firm sponsorships before more lives are ruined.

attributes.action: 'None of the above' as option on ballot paper
attributes.background:
Party Politics can often be seen as a 'Least worst option'.
If we had the option on the ballot paper to indicate 'none of the above' then this positive act would be reflected in the turnout .
attributes.additional_details: The strength of a democracy is measured, in part, by the turnout at elections. This option would increase the intelligence as to what the electorate view of politicians really looks like. As opposed to voting for 'the least worst option'.

attributes.action: Ban fruit and veg being wrapped/packaged in plastic by 2020
attributes.background: The UK government want to eliminate all avoidable plastic waste by 2042, so why not start where its easy. Most fruit and veg don't need packaging at all.  It will be a great place to start to help eliminate all plastic waste which is harmful to the environment and all life, including people.
attributes.additional_details:
Goverments environment plan: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/25-year-environment-plan 

Information about plastic pollution: www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/science-environment-42264788

attributes.action: A Referendum on EU Leaving Deal
attributes.background: A Referendum to decide whether the EU Deal is acceptable to the British People is essential, BEFORE Exit.
attributes.additional_details: A number of petitions (rejected by Government)  have, in Government responses, been rejected "because the people voted to leave". The TERMS under which we leave are important: Deal? or No Deal?. (NOT "Stay in EU"). We MUST have a voice on HOW we are leaving!!! If no Referendum is granted, the next General Election will become a Vote of Confidence in the Government. Negotiators NEED a Referendum to make them concentrate on obtaining an acceptable outcome.

attributes.action: make wrongly reporting someone to a law enforcement agency a criminal offence
attributes.background: At present people who deliberately mislead the police by making false accusations may be prosecuted for a number of offences such as wasting police time or attempting to pervert the court of justice. There is no similar offence where malicious claims are made to other law enforcement agencies.
attributes.additional_details: There are regular prosecutions for wasting police time. Where a person acting maliciously reports his victim to the local authority, the RSPCA, trading standards, health and safety executive, the benefits agency, etc. the effects on the victim can be equally distressing, as well as costly in time and money for both the victim and the investigating agency. Civil redress would usually involve the High Court with a defamation action or similar and is beyond the means of many victims.

attributes.action: Prohibit the act of infant male circumcision without a proper medical reasoning.
attributes.background: Male circumcision in infants is an unnecessary, irreversible and unfair procedure to place upon a boy who may in the future disagree with the reasons for which it was done. Religion and parental opinion are not appropriate reasons to remove a part of a boys body when they lack the ability to refuse.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition goes against strapping a infant boy to a table and cutting away at his genitals without medical reasoning. It does not go against voluntary circumcision by a consenting person.
Issue's like Phimosis, are an appropriate reason to conduct such a procedure as the condition is uncomfortable and fixable. It is known the procedure has no link to higher chances of STD's or HIV in the western world. Promoting safe sex is an alternative to preemptive surgery that is in turn irreversible.

attributes.action: Full funding for Aflibercept, Bevacizumab,Lapatinib,Eribulin, Everolimus
attributes.background: I have cancer and I believe that the drug Bevacizmab would help my treatment and it is not currently funded by the NHS.

attributes.action: Make a legal temperature where it is too hot to attend work or school.
attributes.background: It is too hot for us to work effectively and efficiently this is damaging our health and education.
attributes.additional_details: This is a cause for medical concern as people are fainting and becoming dehydrated due to lack of air conditioning and shaded areas in certain work places and schools.

attributes.action: Create a scheme that encourages those receiving state benefits to litter pick
attributes.background: As we know from recent media attention, litter is blighting our country and wildlife, and the only way to clear it up is to pick it up. The scheme would not only do this, but also give participants a sense of achievement and responsibility, perhaps encouraged by a reward.
attributes.additional_details: Further consideration should be made for the armed forces, whilst not engaged in military action, to contribute manpower to the scheme.

attributes.action: Ban pet shops from selling tortoises
attributes.background: Pet shops do not know how to provide the right care for these reptiles and keep them in the wrong conditions also some are too young to be sold and some are sold when they are ill and die later on.
attributes.additional_details: I bought a tortoise from the local pet shop it was way to young to be sold a little time later it died. I'm not happy with the conditions these poor animals are kept in and I would like it stopped. I would not like any other person or the poor reptiles to experience this.

attributes.action: Recall of MPs Act to include failure of MPs to abide by Constituents’ wishes
attributes.background: The Recall of MPs Act 2015 is very limited in scope. It only covers when an MPs is sentenced to a prison term or is suspended from the House for at least 21 sitting days.  It should be extended to allow for the recall of MPs that ignore the wishes of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.additional_details: A third reason for the Recall of an MP should include acting contrary to their Election Manifesto, by for example voting against something they promised, and acting contrary to the wishes of the majority of their constituents as expressed in a national or local referendum.

attributes.action: Make garden bonfires and any external fires illegal without a permit.
attributes.background: Bonfire smoke is a health risk for people with asthma & breathing problems. Wind will distribute smoke over a wide area, especially in steep sided valleys. It is a basic human right to have access to clean, breathable air. Environmentally safe waste disposal is universally available in the UK.

attributes.action: Base income tax on combined household income for a fair tax system
attributes.background: The current tax system places the highest tax burden by far on single-earner households and many single-earner families are sliding towards poverty due to the unfair tax system while single individuals without children enjoy some of the lowest tax rates of the western world
attributes.additional_details:
The current tax system is based on taxing individuals without taking into account how many additional people such as children depend on that income. It also severly punishes mothers who stay at home, despite research demonstrating that this is the best for young children.
The fairest way to support families is by taxing combined household income. This will also eliminate the unfairness of the High Income Child Benefit Charge threshold, where single-earner families loose the benefit with much lower income than double-earner families.
A tax system that is based on the combined household income is common sense and is the standard in most countries in the western world.
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/women/mother-tongue/8365211/Britain-worst-place-for-tax-burden-on-single-earner-families.html

attributes.action: Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership
attributes.background: There is a growing band of people that want to reverse the result of the democratic vote of this country to leave the European Union and are calling for a second referendum. This is mainly by the people that lost the vote two years ago and cannot accept the democratic vote of the majority decision.
attributes.additional_details: Although not legally, binding the referendum on whether we stay or leave the EU carried out on the 23rd June 2016 was the clearest indication of the will of the electorate. At that time our Prime Minister David Cameron assured us that the result of the referendum would be carried out. We must ensure the democracy rules

attributes.action: Create a regulated market for Ecstasy
attributes.background: Ecstasy a.k.a MDMA or Midomafetamine is a common class A recreational drug deeply infused within British rave and party culture. It has been used as a party drug since the 60’s. Its been illegal since 1977 but this hasnt stopped the shear number of people taking the drug.
attributes.additional_details: This has resulted in a dangerous black market where many deaths have occured due to overdose or due to what has been mixed within the drug. This petition isnt trying to condone the use of the drug but to make a safe, regulated market where if the drug is to be used it is coming from a trustworthy and controlled source. This will ultimately reduce ODs, increase knowledge and education of the drug, create tax revenue, cut out the black market AND SAVE LIVES! Please do some of your own research:)

attributes.action: Provide gym access to all who make national insurance contributions.
attributes.background: Our wonderful NHS is under constant pressure to provide care in our times of need. Targeting healthier living whilst we are able, our times of need may reduce. Some of the costs to becoming healthier should be eradicated and the emphasis placed on exercise becoming an expectation in adult life.
attributes.additional_details: I propose government funded gyms to all who make national insurance contributions. With funds contributed between employer, employee and government. Health is just as important as your pension, and an investment into personal health can only pay us all back. There are many reasons exercise benefits our physical and mental health.

attributes.action: NHS to provide badges for chronically/long term ill people for public transport
attributes.background: Currently NHS doesn’t provide people with chronic illnesses such as endometriosis and long term illnesses which have an impact on the persons quality of life badges for public transport. People with these conditions are extremely poorly would struggle to stand if there were no seats.

attributes.action: Ban vaping in public places
attributes.background: Not enough is known about vaping and its long-term health effects. The Government shouldn’t allow vaping in public places such as public transport. Let’s protect our children and treat it as a potential health problem of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
This article says that there are potential health issues with vaping and more needs to be learnt. Let’s protect ourselves and future generations now. 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/science/2018/jan/29/vaping-may-raise-cancer-and-heart-disease-risk-study-suggests

attributes.action: Make a paid counsellor available for all students in every secondary school
attributes.background: Adolescents aged 11-19 attend secondary school. Ages that bring their own personal, intimate difficulties and ups & downs. They are finding it harder mental health problems. There are many more school nurses on site than counsellors.
attributes.additional_details: Figures suggest 20% of adolescents may experience a mental health problem in any given year, that 50% of mental health problems are established by age 14 with 75% established by age 24. In 2004 10% of children and young people aged 5-16 years had a clinically diagnosable mental health problem; yet in 2008 one study suggested 70% of children & adolescents who experienced mental health problems had not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. It is thought 13% of adolescents try to self harm between ages 11-16. Figures in 2014 suggested a 70% increase in A&E admissions for self-harm over the previous two years.

attributes.action: Require fast food chains to replace promotional images with actual burgers sold
attributes.background: We demand a reality check for large fast food chains. They should be required to replace the unrealistic images in their restaurants with photos of actual burgers that have been cooked in the restaurant, so we can ensure customers know what they are paying for.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media - ShowMeTheBurger
www.showmetheburger.co.uk

attributes.action: Mental health services to become accessible  24/7 including help line funding
attributes.background: After suffering from mental health issues and also close family members I realised that unless you are in a mental health crisis between the hours of 9 - 4.30 Monday to Friday help is few and far between unless you contact 999. The government need to fund help lines with trained professionals.
attributes.additional_details: There are at least 10 different help lines out of these 10 there are only 2 open out of hours . One of these is only voluntary based not professional help and the other is professional led but is so over run with people needing there help they can't keep up . There are millions of people suffering ,the suicide rate is higher than ever with a vast majority of these happening " out of hours" ie weekends evening and nights more needs to be done to take this seriously so that this doesn't happen to another loved one

attributes.action: Make a crime that is motivated by prejudice against homelessness a hate crime.
attributes.background: Homeless people are some of the most vulnerable members of society, but face the risk of physical and verbal attacks by members of the public daily. Homeless people are at risk of having their possessions stolen and subjected to emotional abuse just because they live in absolute poverty.
attributes.additional_details: These are people who are discriminated against because they are affected by poverty. They should be protected by the same laws that protect people from other kinds of hate crimes.

attributes.action: Make sanitary products free for all women
attributes.background: Why should women pay for a something they can't control?
attributes.additional_details: There are women and children missing days at school and work coz they can't afford products to keep them clean.

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance to councils on the eligibility for a disabled travel pass
attributes.background: People applying for a disabled persons pass are being asked for evidence of having had a drivers licence refused on medical grounds, even when they have never applied for a licence. This has happened to many people including myself and others with epilepsy and it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
The Transport Act 2000 says you are eligible if you would be refused a driving licence due to physical fitness, IF you ever applied. The practice of demanding a refusal letter is therefore not correct, as the law does not say you have to have applied for a licence. 

Some authorities now accept a doctor’s letter, but a person has to get this by appointment with a specialist, which can cost up to £200. Clear and legally binding guidance must be issued to all local authorities so that they understand what the law actually says and stop denying disabled people what they are legally entitled to.

attributes.action: Clamp down on sexual harassment in clubs with nationally enforced regulations
attributes.background: Sexual harassment is an endemic issue faced by women on nights out in this country. It is disgraceful in 2018 that persistent unwanted attention and groping are just part of going out for women. Clubs and live music venues must appoint trained staff inside their premises to combat this issue
attributes.additional_details: My suggestion is either existing staff are redistributed or new bouncers appointed to monitor the inside of the clubs. These bouncers would be easily visible so women can report any perpetuators without trouble and feel more safe and comfortable on nights out. Funding required in some cases could be provided by the government

attributes.action: Introduce laws to stop the sale of knives from easily viewable display cases.
attributes.background: With the increase of knife attacks across the UK. We are asking for tighter laws controlling the sale of knives from display cases. Knifes should be sold from covered cabinets. You can't buy cigarettes from open displays due to the impact on health. We should treat the sale of knives the same way.
attributes.additional_details: Open and easily viewable cases that display knives are showing them as glamour items. They show knives and advertise them as exciting accessible items. Take a store in Sheffield that is displaying knives like the USMC Ka-bar. This is clearly a military knife. If knives are not on display and are not easily viewed, accessible or advertised in a glamorous ways. People that use them genuine reasons will have to ask for them. This allows for retailers to question their legitimate use and purpose.

attributes.action: Ban Concentrated Animal feeding Operations (CAFO) in the UK
attributes.background: CAFOs are common in the US, but are now beginning to appear in the UK. These huge industrial farms are inhumane and should not be allowed in this country. We believe they should be banned on animal welfare grounds.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/may/29/revealed-industrial-scale-beef-farming-comes-to-the-uk

https://www.thebureauinvestigates.com/stories/2017-07-17/intensive-numbers-of-intensive-farming

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/the-controversial-mega-dairies-that-alarm-campaigners-and-divide-a-struggling-sector-of-british-a6744511.html%3famp

www.telegraph.co.uk/pets/news-features/does-uk-really-want-mega-farms/amp/

attributes.action: Schools to teach anti crime and anti gang culture within schools.
attributes.background: With the constant rise in gang related death and crime it’s time to make a difference. Schools should teach anti crime and anti gang culture as early as junior school. We all need to work together to make a difference.
attributes.additional_details:
No parent wants to hear their child is the victim of crime bullying or hate, but worse still no one wants that knock at the door to say their child has died as a victim of it! 
Stop it before it starts we need to stamp out the whole gang culture that is rapidly growing within our schools and streets.
Children become involved due to peer pressure and it becomes a case of be a bully or be a victim! It has to stop.
Schools to clamp down and teach strict anti gang bullying and crime in schools.

attributes.action: Add tattoos to the protected characteristics under The Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop discrimination towards people with tattoos by signing this petition to add tattoos to the list of protected characteristics. This would mean employers cannot force employees to cover visible tattoos, as long as these aren't deemed offensive language or to any of the 9 existing characteristics.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 3 young adults in the UK have at least 1 tattoo today and this is still growing. Tattoos are part of different cultures throughout the world and are simply part of a person when they have them done. It is offensive and should be illegal for an employer to say to someone to cover their skin because they don’t like someone’s tattoo(s).

attributes.action: Make pas43 a minimum legal requirement for all breakdown and recovery personnel
attributes.background: After working with various company’s doing roadside breakdowns and recovery, some of which apply pas43. The dangers of this are horrifying. I think it’s about time these guidelines were made legal as a minimum requirement to get rid of the cowboys and to reduce further risk to everyone
attributes.additional_details:
Where some company’s will use pas43 and stick to the guidelines, give staff the required training. There are still company’s out there that will send untrained staff in any vehicle to broken down vehicles which are ill equipped and have no extra reflectors or beacon. 
I have also have an email from a parliament case worker stating pas43 is not a legal requirement and is down to the company health and safety to make sure that staff know what they are doing at the roadside. This needs to change!

attributes.action: Suspend the lease rental rule change from 130g/km emissions to 110g/km ASAP
attributes.background:
New lease rental restriction bands from April 2018 are negatively impacting company new car sales contributing to job losses across the UK.
Employees paying company car tax support’s the Treasury coffers by millions of pounds, but is in serious decline due too many alterations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/lease-rental-restrictions/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/company-car-tax-to-change-over-to-new-wltp-emission-rules-from-april-2020/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/new-202021-company-car-tax-bands-favour-ultra-low-emission-vehicles/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/
https://www.businesscarmanager.co.uk/800000-drivers-face-70m-diesel-company-car-tax-hike/

attributes.action: Convert & retain The European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) into U.K. law
attributes.background: After Brexit, the European Convention, and the Human Rights Act which enshrines it in UK law, will be more important than ever. They will remain the most fundamental safeguard against abuses of human rights in the UK. This needs to be protected and converted to U.K. law before it’s too late!

attributes.action: Stop all animal testing in the UK
attributes.background: Animals are dying from animal testing and it isn’t fair on them as they have lives that they should be able to live

attributes.action: Fund research into carbohydrate polymers as an alternative to plastic
attributes.background: As you are aware, in the UK we create tonnes of plastic waste daily and this is becoming an increasing problem. We need to cut down on the plastic we are using. To overcome this, we can use carbohydrate polymers (cellophane) but the problem is there is not enough funding to support research into it.

attributes.action: Urge the UN to refer Southern Cameroons (SC) impasse to the ICJ.
attributes.background: There are serious human rights violations taking place in the Anglophone-speaking areas of Cameroon including killings, arrests, torture, disappearances, rape and the razing of whole villages after protests against assimilation. The SC impasse must be referred to the ICJ to solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
In 1961, instead of properly decolonising SC, Britain and the United Nations effectively annexed SC to RC. After unjustly ruling out full independence for SC, the self rule envisaged by UNGA Res 1608 (XV) of 21/04/61 in a federation of two states equal in status was never properly implemented. Today, our Anglo-Saxon educational, legal, economic and socio-cultural systems are under attack by RC assimilationists. 

We want the ICJ to rule in favour of a referendum for us to determine our future.

attributes.action: The right to register with two GPs for students studying away from home
attributes.background: Currently in the UK, you can only register to one GP (General Practitioner) at a time. People tend to register to the one nearest to their home address, but what if you're constantly going back and forth between two addresses? This is a problem students studying away from home have to face.
attributes.additional_details:
During each year of study, students receive 3 main holidays, this includes 3-4 weeks at Christmas and Easter and almost 3 months summer holiday. It is not uncommon to need health treatment during these periods, however, receiving the care needed can be a nightmare!

Not all GPs offer temporary registration, imagine the hassle of constantly having to re-register between two GPs. This also causes unnecessary inconvenience for GPs who constantly have to send patients files and data back and forth.

attributes.action: Require cars to be impounded or crushed for leaving dogs in hot cars.
attributes.background: Unfortunately we see so many dogs left in hot cars during peak summer periods due to owners whom haven't a clue. Although social media are widely broadcasting this they still leave dogs in cars. The fear of your pride and joy being crushed may just be the wake up call they need.

attributes.action: Debate scrapping the television licence fee and discuss other funding options.
attributes.background: We currently pay £147 per year for a TV licence, the bulk of which goes to the BBC, very little BBC programming these days is of the quality expected, please debate in the Commons with regards scrapping this fee and discuss more viable funding options.

attributes.action: Get the UK to ban all single use plastic items by 2030.
attributes.background:
Around 8 million tons of plastic enter the oceans each year, which is like emptying a garbage truck of plastic into an ocean every minute.

Governments MUST realize that the convenience of plastic is not worth the harm it causes

attributes.action: Require a child train fare to be ages 5-16 whilst in full time education
attributes.background: Rail companies define child fares as from age 5-15. But a 16 year old can still be at school (Year 11) and has to pay an adult fare.
attributes.additional_details: Companies cite the young person railcard however this cannot be used for morning fares, season tickets or fares under a certain cost. Student discounts aren't available until Year 12. This means that in their most important year 16 year old children and their family are facing the stress of paying double the amount. http://www.nationalrail.co.uk/times_fares/46494.aspx
